text.Department of Modern Languages and Liter: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

li.Completion of FRE 2201 with a \"C\" (2.0: Completion of FRE 2201 with a "C" (2.0) or better.

courseSection0.text:
Minor Admission Requirements
Completion of FRE 2201 with a "C" (2.0) or better.
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
FRE 2201 or equivalent

courseSection0.text0: Students must take one (1) course in French composition and one (1) course in French oral communication.
courseSection0.text1: Native or near-native speakers of French can substitute FRE 3420, FRE 4422, FRE 3760, and FRE 4421 with an elective course in FRE, FRT, FRW, or FOW
courseSection0.text2:
French Composition: 
A native or near-native speaker must substitute an alternate upper division course.
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
FRE3420 - French Composition (3)
FRE4422 - Advanced French Composition (3)
courseSection0.text3:
French Oral Communication:
A native or near-native speaker must substitute an alternate upper division course.
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
FRE3760 - Advanced French Oral Communication (3)
FRE4421 - Advanced French Conversation (3)

courseSection1.text0:
Earn at least 12 credits from the following types of courses: 
Select 4 upper-division FRE, FRW, FRT, or FOW courses offered in the Department of Modern Languages not already used to satisfy the minor.
courseSection1.text1: Meet with a program advisor prior to registration.
courseSection1.text2: A list of approved restricted elective courses is found in the myKnight audit

li.A grade of \"C\" (2.0) or better is requ: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.At least 12 hours used in the minor must: At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.A maximum of 6 hours of study abroad cre: A maximum of 6 hours of study abroad credit may be applied to the minor at the program director's discretion.
li.No credit exam (TSD, Military credit) ma: No credit exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study: Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit may be used toward the minor with departmental permission.

courseSection0.text:
Other Requirements

A grade of "C" (2.0) or better is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
A maximum of 6 hours of study abroad credit may be applied to the minor at the program director's discretion.
No credit exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit may be used toward the minor with departmental permission.
